Ucreavvesh, You don't understand my comment.  It is a response to the first reply to the OP.   The original comment I responded to made no distinction between "Europeans who came here for a better life,"  and Europeans who came here to "invade."  From the standpoint of the natives, it is doubtful you can separate the two without very strict controls on migration.  So since you do see a distinction between the two (as I also do), then is it safe to say you favor strict regulation of who is allowed to migrate into our country?  I certainly agree that the Native Americans would have benefited from a very strict migration policy, of course, this is hindsight and, of course, they were at a technological and epidemiological disadvantage.  I'm familiar with history, I was being intentionally provocative.
